section_id: ## 14. Resolution of Causality Issue (Issue #3) via Causal Set Structure

hints.label: thm-causal-episodes-locality
hints.title: Causal Episodes Have Strict Light-Cone Constraint
hints.content:
2271: :label: thm-causal-episodes-locality
2272: 
2273: From {doc}`13_fractal_set_new/11_causal_sets.md`, Definition 3.1.1 (Causal Order on Fractal Set), episodes $e_i, e_j \in E$ satisfy:
2274: 
2275: $$
2276: e_i \prec_{\text{CST}} e_j \quad \iff \quad t_i < t_j \text{ AND } d_{\mathcal{X}}(x_i, x_j) < c_{\text{eff}}(t_j - t_i)
2277: $$
2278: 
2279: where:
2280: - $d_{\mathcal{X}}(x_i, x_j)$ is the **Riemannian distance** on $(\mathcal{X}, g)$
2281: - $c_{\text{eff}} = \epsilon_c/\tau$ is the effective speed of light
2282: 
2283: **Physical meaning**: Episode $e_i$ can only **causally influence** episode $e_j$ if $e_j$ is **within the future light cone** of $e_i$.

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-35
hints.content:
2287: 
2288: :::{prf:proof}
2289: **Step 1: Episode generation process.**
2290: 
2291: From {doc}`13_fractal_set_new/02_computational_equivalence.md`, episodes are generated by the discrete-time Markov chain with BAOAB updates. At each timestep $k$:
2292: 
2293: 1. Kinetic operator updates $(x_i, v_i)$ for time $\Delta t = \tau$
2294: 2. Maximum spatial displacement: $\Delta x_{\max} = v_{\max} \tau + O(\tau^2)$
2295: 3. Cloning can only occur between walkers at positions $(x_i, x_j)$ existing at time $t$
2296: 
2297: **Step 2: Causal diamond constraint.**
2298: 
2299: For walker $i$ at $(t_i, x_i)$ to influence walker $j$ at $(t_j, x_j)$, there must exist a **chain of episodes**:
2300: 
2301: $$
2302: e_i = e_0 \prec e_1 \prec \cdots \prec e_n = e_j
2303: $$
2304: 
2305: Each link satisfies:
2306: 
2307: $$
2308: d_{\mathcal{X}}(x_k, x_{k+1}) < c_{\text{eff}} (t_{k+1} - t_k)
2309: $$
2310: 
2311: By transitivity (Axiom CS2, proven in Theorem 3.2 of 11_causal_sets.md):
2312: 
2313: $$
2314: d_{\mathcal{X}}(x_i, x_j) \leq \sum_{k=0}^{n-1} d_{\mathcal{X}}(x_k, x_{k+1}) < c_{\text{eff}}(t_j - t_i)
2315: $$
2316: 
2317: **Step 3: No influence outside light cone.**
2318: 
2319: If $(x_i, t_i)$ and $(x_j, t_j)$ are **spacelike separated**:
2320: 
2321: $$
2322: d_{\mathcal{X}}(x_i, x_j) > c_{\text{eff}}(t_j - t_i)
2323: $$
2324: 
2325: then $e_i \not\prec e_j$, and **no causal chain exists** connecting them. The cloning kernel $K_{\text{clone}}(x_i, x_j)$ may be non-zero, but **the interaction never occurs** because the episodes are not causally connected in the Fractal Set.

hints.label: prop-causal-truncation
hints.title: Causal Truncation Makes Kernel Effectively Local
hints.content:
2347: :label: prop-causal-truncation
2348: 
2349: Define the **causally truncated kernel**:
2350: 
2351: $$
2352: K_{\text{causal}}(e_i, e_j) := \begin{cases}
2353: K_{\text{clone}}(x_i, v_i, x_j, v_j) & \text{if } e_i \prec_{\text{CST}} e_j \\
2354: 0 & \text{otherwise}
2355: \end{cases}
2356: $$
2357: 
2358: This kernel has **effective compact support**: For any episode $e_i$, the set of episodes that can be influenced is:
2359: 
2360: $$
2361: \mathcal{C}^+(e_i) := \{e_j : e_i \prec_{\text{CST}} e_j\} \subset \{e_j : d_{\mathcal{X}}(x_i, x_j) < c_{\text{eff}}(t_j - t_i)\}
2362: $$

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-114
hints.content:
2366: 
2367: :::{prf:proof}
2368: **Step 1: Causal future is bounded.**
2369: 
2370: For episodes with $e_i \prec e_j$, we have:
2371: 
2372: $$
2373: d_{\mathcal{X}}(x_i, x_j) < c_{\text{eff}}(t_j - t_i)
2374: $$
2375: 
2376: For any **finite time interval** $t_j - t_i \leq T$, this constrains $x_j$ to lie within a ball of radius $c_{\text{eff}} T$ around $x_i$.
2377: 
2378: **Step 2: Kernel effectively vanishes outside causal diamond.**
2379: 
2380: For spacelike-separated events with $d_{\mathcal{X}}(x_i, x_j) > c_{\text{eff}}(t_j - t_i)$:
2381: 
2382: $$
2383: K_{\text{causal}}(e_i, e_j) = 0 \quad \text{(exactly, not exponentially suppressed)}
2384: $$
2385: 
2386: **Step 3: Microcausality in QFT limit.**
2387: 
2388: In the continuum limit $N \to \infty, \tau \to 0$, the causal set structure converges to the **Lorentzian light-cone structure** (Theorem 4.1 in 11_causal_sets.md, "Faithful Discretization"). Time-evolved field operators automatically satisfy:
2389: 
2390: $$
2391: [\psi(x, t), \psi(y, s)] = 0 \quad \text{for } (x-y)^2 - c_{\text{eff}}^2(t-s)^2 > 0
2392: $$

hints.label: thm-causality-continuum-preserved
hints.title: Causality Preserved in Continuum Limit
hints.content:
2400: :label: thm-causality-continuum-preserved
2401: 
2402: From {doc}`13_fractal_set_new/02_computational_equivalence.md`, the discrete-time Markov chain generating the Fractal Set has:
2403: 
2404: 1. **Geometric ergodicity** (Theorem `thm-fractal-set-ergodicity`)
2405: 2. **Convergence inheritance** (Corollary `cor-convergence-inheritance`)
2406: 3. **Weak convergence** $\pi_{\Delta t} \to \pi$ as $\tau \to 0$ (Theorem `thm-weak-convergence-invariant`)
2407: 
2408: **Claim**: These convergence results **preserve the causal structure**.
2409: 
2410: **Proof**:
2411: 
2412: The causal order $\prec_{\text{CST}}$ is a **topological property** of the Fractal Set graph. It is **invariant** under the dynamics because:
2413: 
2414: 1. **Temporal ordering preserved**: BAOAB updates preserve $t_i < t_j$ for all walker pairs
2415: 2. **Spatial locality preserved**: Maximum displacement per timestep is $\Delta x \sim v_{\max} \tau$, which defines $c_{\text{eff}}$
2416: 3. **Propagation of chaos**: The O(1/√N) convergence rate (Section 5 of 02_computational_equivalence.md) shows that N-particle interactions converge to mean-field, but **causal structure persists** in the limit
